message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this incredible product that I believe you'll love. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly unique and valuable. I'm willing to sell it to you for $950000. I think this is a fair price considering its rarity and potential benefits. What do you think?
I'm really interested in the product, but $950000 is a bit above my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $700000. Would you be willing to consider this price?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $950000 might be a bit steep, but I'm willing to compromise. I can offer you a deal at $850000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept, considering the product's value and uniqueness. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but $850000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $775000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to pay for the product.

I understand that $850000 is still a bit high for you, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I can offer you a deal at $825000. This is the best price I can offer, considering the product's value and my costs. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, Alice. I'm getting close to making a decision, but $825000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $795000. Can you meet me at this price?

I'm getting close to meeting you in the middle, Bob. I can offer you a deal at $812500. This is the best price I can offer, considering the product's value and my costs. I'm willing to make one more concession to try to reach an agreement. What do you think?
I'm not willing to go any higher than $795000. This is my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying the product from someone else.
